medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of sharp right upper quadrant pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a history of acute onset sharp pain in the right upper quadrant, rated in severity, radiating to the right lower quadrant. Symptoms included nausea and vomiting for an unspecified duration.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Right middle cerebellar peduncle cavernous angioma diagnosed and resected. 2. Chronic headaches, followed by specialists. 3. Chronic microcytic anemia with a baseline hematocrit of approximately 38. 4. Pilonidal cyst status post surgery.
medical_history.family_history: Diabetes Mellitus and Hypertension (father); Myocardial Infarction (grandfather).
